message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about ecosystems. Ecosystems are communities that consist of a variety of living beings, including plants, animals, and microorganisms. Option (A) is incorrect because ecosystems include both plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems contain multiple species of animals. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems can be found in various locations around the world, not just on specific continents.

This question requires basic knowledge about ecosystems. Ecosystems are communities that consist of a variety of living organisms, including plants, animals, and microorganisms. Option (A) is incorrect because ecosystems include both plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems contain a variety of animal species, not just a single species. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems can be found on all continents.

This question requires knowledge about the definition of an ecosystem. Ecosystems are communities of living organisms in conjunction with the nonliving components in their environment. They consist of a multitude of different organisms, including plants, animals, and microorganisms. Option (A) is incorrect because ecosystems include both plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems contain multiple species of animals. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems can be found on every continent.

This question tests knowledge about ecosystems and their characteristics. Ecosystems are communities of living organisms, including plants, animals, and microorganisms, that interact with each other and their environment. Option (A) is incorrect because ecosystems contain both plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems consist of multiple species of animals, not just one. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems are present on every continent, not just certain ones. Option (B), the correct answer, accurately reflects the diverse and interconnected nature of ecosystems.

Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems contain animals of different species. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems can be found on every continent.

This question requires knowledge about what an ecosystem is. An ecosystem is a community of living organisms (plants, animals, and microorganisms) interacting with nonliving components (such as air, water, and soil). Option (A) is incorrect because ecosystems contain both plants and animals. Option (C) is incorrect because ecosystems are composed of multiple species, not just the same species. Option (D) is incorrect because ecosystems can be found on all continents. Option (B) is the correct answer because it accurately describes the diverse collection of living beings found within an ecosystem.
